page.title: 19 BRICKFIELD STUD, EXNING
page.content: We went to visit a local stud. It covers an area of 87 acres. As well as the American-style stables there are offices, sitting-up rooms and workers' houses. The owner has his own house, garden and tennis court. There are no stallions at this stud. The mares are sent away to other establishments to be covered, quite often to Ireland. This breeding season they had 8 fillies and 6 colts but sadly 2 colts died. In the winter the mares stay in the stables but in the summer they graze in the paddocks. The hay is imported from America because it is much richer in protein. The yearly bill for hay is at least 15,000 pounds. The stud employs 8 men. They work from 7.00am to 7.00pm in the summer but finish work at 5.00pm in the winter.
